hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During holiday periods with thin liquidity, a sharp compression in BTC 1-day realized volatility below 30% followed by a 2%+ price move in either direction will trigger a sustained volatility expansion over the next 3 days, with the expansion direction continuing the initial breakout move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday trading creates structural liquidity gaps. When volatility compresses to extreme lows in this environment, any catalyst can trigger outsized moves as resting orders are swept. The initial direction often persists due to slow reaction times of sidelined capital.
entry_conditions: BTC price moves >2% from previous day's close in a single 4-hour candle
Total crypto market volume (excl. stablecoins) < $25B (confirming thin liquidity)

exit_conditions.take_profit: When 3-day realized volatility post-entry exceeds 70% OR price reaches +8%/-6% from entry (directional)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: If volatility re-compresses below 35% within 48 hours of entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 72 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such breakouts immediately reverse and close back within the pre-breakout range within 24 hours, invalidating the momentum continuation premise.
